name: AgentQL
description: Enable AI agents to get structured data from unstructured web with AgentQL.
summary: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates AgentQL's data extraction capabilities, allowing users to extract structured data from web pages.

tools.name: extract-web-data
tools.description: Extracts structured data from a given URL using a prompt to describe the data and fields to extract.

parameter.url: (string) The URL of the web page to extract data from.
parameter.prompt: (string) A description of the actual data and its fields to extract.

name: Aiven
description: Navigate your Aiven projects and interact with the PostgreSQL®, Apache Kafka®, ClickHouse® and OpenSearch® services
summary: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Aiven, providing access to various Aiven services such as PostgreSQL, Kafka, ClickHouse, Valkey, and OpenSearch, enabling LLMs to build full stack solutions.

tools.name: list_projects
tools.description: List all projects on your Aiven account.

tools.name: list_services
tools.description: List all services in a specific Aiven project.

tools.name: get_service_details
tools.description: Get the detail of your service in a specific Aiven project.

name: Alibaba Cloud AnalyticDB for MySQL
description: Connect to a AnalyticDB for MySQL cluster for getting database or table metadata, querying and analyzing data.It will be supported to add the openapi for cluster operation in the future.
summary: A universal interface between AI Agents and AnalyticDB for MySQL databases, enabling seamless communication for retrieving database metadata and executing SQL operations.

tools.name: execute_sql
tools.description: Execute a SQL query in the AnalyticDB for MySQL Cluster

tools.name: get_query_plan
tools.description: Get the query plan for a SQL query

tools.name: get_execution_plan
tools.description: Get the actual execution plan with runtime statistics for a SQL query

name: Apache IoTDB
description: MCP Server for Apache IoTDB database and its tools
summary: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that provides database interaction and business intelligence capabilities through IoTDB. It enables running SQL queries.

tools.name: metadata_query
tools.description: Execute SHOW/COUNT queries to read metadata from the database

parameter.query_sql: (string) The SHOW/COUNT SQL query to execute

tools.name: select_query
tools.description: Execute SELECT queries to read data from the database

parameter.query_sql: (string) The SELECT SQL query to execute

tools.name: read_query
tools.description: Execute SELECT queries to read data from the database

parameter.query: (string) The SELECT SQL query to execute

tools.name: list_tables
tools.description: Get a list of all tables in the database

tools.name: describe-table
tools.description: View schema information for a specific table

name: Apify
description: Actors MCP Server: Use 3,000+ pre-built cloud tools to extract data from websites, e-commerce, social media, search engines, maps, and more
summary: The Apify MCP Server enables interaction with Apify Actors as tools for performing various tasks, such as data extraction, web searching, and more. It supports both HTTP server (SSE) and local server (stdio) modes, and can be integrated with various MCP clients.

tools.name: get-actor-details
tools.description: Retrieves documentation, input schema, and details about a specific Actor.

tools.name: discover-actors
tools.description: Searches for relevant Actors using keywords and returns their details.

tools.name: add-actor-as-tool
tools.description: Adds an Actor by name to the available tools list without executing it, requiring user consent to run later.

tools.name: remove-actor-from-tool
tools.description: Removes an Actor by name from the available tools list when it's no longer needed.

name: APIMatic MCP
description: APIMatic MCP Server is used to validate OpenAPI specifications using APIMatic. The server processes OpenAPI files and returns validation summaries by leveraging APIMatic’s API.
summary: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) Server for validating OpenAPI specifications using APIMatic. It supports OpenAPI 2.0 and 3.0 files in both JSON and YAML formats, leveraging APIMatic’s API for comprehensive validation.

tools.name: validate-openapi-using-apimatic
tools.description: Validates an OpenAPI file using APIMatic’s API and returns a validation summary.

name: Arize Phoenix
description: Inspect traces, manage prompts, curate datasets, and run experiments using Arize Phoenix, an open-source AI and LLM observability tool.
summary: An open-source AI observability platform designed for experimentation, evaluation, and troubleshooting. It provides tracing, evaluation, dataset management, experiment tracking, a playground for optimizing prompts, and prompt management.

tools.name: arize-phoenix-otel
tools.description: Provides a lightweight wrapper around OpenTelemetry primitives with Phoenix-aware defaults

tools.name: arize-phoenix-client
tools.description: Lightweight client for interacting with the Phoenix server via its OpenAPI REST interface

tools.name: arize-phoenix-evals
tools.description: Tooling to evaluate LLM applications including RAG relevance, answer relevance, and more

tools.name: @arizeai/phoenix-client
tools.description: Client for the Arize Phoenix API

tools.name: @arizeai/phoenix-mcp
tools.description: MCP server implementation for Arize Phoenix providing a unified interface to Phoenix's capabilities

name: Astra DB
description: Comprehensive tools for managing collections and documents in a DataStax Astra DB NoSQL database with a full range of operations such as create, update, delete, find, and associated bulk actions.
summary: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with Astra DB, extending the capabilities of Large Language Models (LLMs) by allowing them to interact with external systems as agents.

tools.name: GetCollections
tools.description: Get all collections in the database

tools.name: CreateCollection
tools.description: Create a new collection in the database

tools.name: UpdateCollection
tools.description: Update an existing collection in the database

tools.name: DeleteCollection
tools.description: Delete a collection from the database

tools.name: ListRecords
tools.description: List records from a collection in the database

tools.name: GetRecord
tools.description: Get a specific record from a collection by ID

tools.name: CreateRecord
tools.description: Create a new record in a collection

tools.name: UpdateRecord
tools.description: Update an existing record in a collection

tools.name: DeleteRecord
tools.description: Delete a record from a collection

tools.name: FindRecord
tools.description: Find records in a collection by field value

tools.name: BulkCreateRecords
tools.description: Create multiple records in a collection at once

tools.name: BulkUpdateRecords
tools.description: Update multiple records in a collection at once

tools.name: BulkDeleteRecords
tools.description: Delete multiple records from a collection at once

tools.name: OpenBrowser
tools.description: Open a web browser for authentication and setup

tools.name: HelpAddToClient
tools.description: Get assistance with adding Astra DB client to your MCP client

tools.name: EstimateDocumentCount
tools.description: Get estimate of the number of documents in a collection

name: Audiense Insights
description: Marketing insights and audience analysis from Audiense reports, covering demographic, cultural, influencer, and content engagement analysis.
summary: This server allows MCP-compatible clients to interact with an Audiense Insights account, extracting marketing insights and audience analysis including demographic, cultural, influencer, and content engagement data.

tools.name: get-reports
tools.description: Retrieves the list of Audiense insights reports owned by the authenticated user.

tools.name: get-report-info
tools.description: Fetches detailed information about a specific intelligence report, including status, segmentation type, audience size, segments, and access links.

parameter.report_id: (string) The ID of the intelligence report.

tools.name: get-audience-insights
tools.description: Retrieves aggregated insights for a given audience, including demographics, behavioral traits, psychographics, and socioeconomic factors.

parameter.audience_insights_id: (string) The ID of the audience insights.
parameter.insights: (array of strings, optional) List of specific insight names to filter.

tools.name: get-baselines
tools.description: Retrieves available baseline audiences, optionally filtered by country.

parameter.country: (string, optional) ISO country code to filter by.

tools.name: get-categories
tools.description: Retrieves the list of available affinity categories that can be used in influencer comparisons.

tools.name: compare-audience-influencers
tools.description: Compares influencers of a given audience with a baseline audience, providing affinity scores, baseline comparisons, and uniqueness scores.

parameter.baseline_audience_influencers_id: (string) ID of the baseline audience influencers.
parameter.count: (number, optional) Number of items per page (default: 200).
parameter.bio_keyword: (string, optional) Filter influencers by bio keyword.
parameter.entity_type: (enum: person | brand, optional) Filter by entity type.
parameter.categories: (array of strings, optional) Filter influencers by categories.
parameter.countries: (array of strings, optional) Filter influencers by country ISO codes.

tools.name: get-audience-content
tools.description: Retrieves audience content engagement details, including liked, shared, and influential content.

parameter.audience_content_id: (string) The ID of the audience content.

tools.name: report-summary
tools.description: Generates a comprehensive summary of an Audiense report, including metadata, audience size, segment information, top insights, and top influencers with comparison metrics.

parameter.report_id: (string) The ID of the intelligence report to summarize.

name: AWS
description: Specialized MCP servers that bring AWS best practices directly to your development workflow.
summary: A suite of specialized MCP servers that help you get the most out of AWS, wherever you use MCP. These servers enhance the capabilities of foundation models by providing relevant information, access to the latest documentation, workflow automation, and specialized domain knowledge for AWS services.

tools.name: Search Documentation
tools.description: Search AWS documentation and best practices using the official AWS search API.

tools.name: Get Content Recommendations
tools.description: Get content recommendations for AWS documentation pages.

tools.name: Convert Documentation to Markdown
tools.description: Convert AWS documentation to markdown format.

tools.name: Discover Knowledge Bases
tools.description: Discover Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Bases and their data sources.

tools.name: Query Knowledge Bases
tools.description: Query Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Bases with natural language.

tools.name: Filter Results by Data Source
tools.description: Filter query results by data source.

tools.name: Rerank Results
tools.description: Rerank query results.

tools.name: AWS CDK Project Analysis
tools.description: Analyze and assist with AWS CDK projects.

tools.name: CDK Construct Recommendations
tools.description: Provide recommendations for CDK constructs.

tools.name: Infrastructure as Code Best Practices
tools.description: Provide best practices for infrastructure as code.

tools.name: Analyze and Visualize Costs
tools.description: Analyze and visualize AWS costs.

tools.name: Query Cost Data with Natural Language
tools.description: Query cost data using natural language.

tools.name: Generate Cost Reports and Insights
tools.description: Generate detailed cost reports and insights.

tools.name: Text-Based Image Generation
tools.description: Generate images using text with customizable parameters.

tools.name: Color-Guided Image Generation
tools.description: Generate images with specific color palettes.

tools.name: Save Generated Images
tools.description: Save generated images to the workspace.

tools.name: Generate Professional Diagrams
tools.description: Generate professional diagrams using Python code.

tools.name: Customize Diagram Appearance
tools.description: Customize the appearance, layout, and styling of diagrams.

tools.name: Code Scanning for Secure Diagram Generation
tools.description: Scan code to ensure secure diagram generation.

tools.name: Run AWS Lambda Functions
tools.description: Select and run AWS Lambda functions as MCP tools without code changes.

tools.name: Security-First Development Workflow
tools.description: Implement a security-first development workflow.

tools.name: Checkov Integration
tools.description: Integrate Checkov for security checks.

tools.name: AWS and AWSCC Provider Documentation
tools.description: Provide documentation for AWS and AWSCC providers.

tools.name: AWS-IA GenAI Modules
tools.description: Use AWS-IA GenAI modules.

tools.name: Terraform Workflow Execution
tools.description: Execute Terraform workflows.

tools.name: Search for Places Using Geocoding
tools.description: Search for places using geocoding.

tools.name: Get Details for Specific Places
tools.description: Get details for specific places by PlaceId.

tools.name: Reverse Geocode Coordinates to Addresses
tools.description: Reverse geocode coordinates to addresses.

tools.name: Search for Places Near a Location
tools.description: Search for places near a specified location.

tools.name: Search for Places That Are Currently Open
tools.description: Search for places that are currently open.

tools.name: Calculate Routes Between Locations
tools.description: Calculate routes between locations with turn-by-turn directions.

tools.name: Optimize Waypoints for Efficient Routing
tools.description: Optimize waypoints for efficient routing.

tools.name: Repository Indexing
tools.description: Index Git repositories using FAISS and Amazon Bedrock embeddings.

tools.name: Semantic Search Within Repositories
tools.description: Perform semantic search within repositories.

tools.name: Repository Structure Analysis
tools.description: Analyze the structure of repositories.

tools.name: GitHub Repository Search in AWS Organizations
tools.description: Search GitHub repositories within AWS organizations.

tools.name: File Access with Text and Binary Support
tools.description: Access files with text and binary support.

name: Axiom
description: Query and analyze your Axiom logs, traces, and all other event data in natural language
summary: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Axiom that allows AI agents to query data using Axiom Processing Language (APL). It supports executing APL queries and listing available datasets.

tools.name: queryApl
tools.description: Execute APL queries against Axiom datasets

tools.name: listDatasets
tools.description: List available Axiom datasets

name: Azure
description: The Azure MCP Server gives MCP Clients access to key Azure services and tools like Azure Storage, Cosmos DB, the Azure CLI, and more.
summary: The Azure MCP Server implements the MCP specification to create a seamless connection between AI agents and key Azure services, including Azure Storage, Cosmos DB, and more. It enables AI agents to interact with Azure resources through smart JSON communication, natural language commands, intelligent parameter suggestions, and consistent error handling.

tools.name: List Azure AI Search services
tools.description: Lists all Azure AI Search services.

tools.name: List indexes and look at their schema and configuration
tools.description: Lists indexes and provides details about their schema and configuration.

tools.name: Query search indexes
tools.description: Queries search indexes for specific data.

tools.name: List Cosmos DB accounts
tools.description: Lists all Cosmos DB accounts.

tools.name: List and query databases
tools.description: Lists and queries databases within a Cosmos DB account.

tools.name: Manage containers and items
tools.description: Manages containers and items within a Cosmos DB database.

tools.name: Execute SQL queries against containers
tools.description: Executes SQL queries against containers within a Cosmos DB database.

tools.name: List and query databases
tools.description: Lists and queries databases within an Azure Database for PostgreSQL - Flexible Server.

tools.name: List and get schema for tables
tools.description: Lists and retrieves the schema for tables within an Azure Database for PostgreSQL - Flexible Server.

tools.name: List, get configuration and get parameters for servers
tools.description: Lists, retrieves configuration, and retrieves parameters for servers within an Azure Database for PostgreSQL - Flexible Server.

tools.name: List Kusto clusters
tools.description: Lists all Kusto clusters.

tools.name: List databases in a Kusto cluster
tools.description: Lists databases within a Kusto cluster.

tools.name: List tables in a Kusto database
tools.description: Lists tables within a Kusto database.

tools.name: Get schema for a Kusto table
tools.description: Retrieves the schema for a Kusto table.

tools.name: Sample rows from a Kusto table
tools.description: Samples rows from a Kusto table.

tools.name: Query Kusto databases using KQL
tools.description: Queries Kusto databases using KQL.

tools.name: List Storage accounts
tools.description: Lists all Storage accounts.

tools.name: Manage blob containers and blobs
tools.description: Manages blob containers and blobs within a Storage account.

tools.name: List and query Storage tables
tools.description: Lists and queries tables within a Storage account.

tools.name: Get container properties and metadata
tools.description: Retrieves properties and metadata for a Storage container.

tools.name: List Log Analytics workspaces
tools.description: Lists all Log Analytics workspaces.

tools.name: Query logs using KQL
tools.description: Queries logs using KQL.

tools.name: List available tables
tools.description: Lists available tables within a Log Analytics workspace.

tools.name: Configure monitoring options
tools.description: Configures monitoring options within a Log Analytics workspace.

tools.name: List App Configuration stores
tools.description: Lists all App Configuration stores.

tools.name: Manage key-value pairs
tools.description: Manages key-value pairs within an App Configuration store.

tools.name: Handle labeled configurations
tools.description: Handles labeled configurations within an App Configuration store.

tools.name: Lock/unlock configuration settings
tools.description: Locks or unlocks configuration settings within an App Configuration store.

tools.name: List, create, and get keys
tools.description: Lists, creates, and retrieves keys within an Azure Key Vault.

tools.name: List resource groups
tools.description: Lists all resource groups.

tools.name: Resource group management operations
tools.description: Performs management operations on resource groups.

tools.name: Execute Azure CLI commands directly
tools.description: Executes Azure CLI commands directly.

tools.name: Support for all Azure CLI functionality
tools.description: Supports all Azure CLI functionality.

tools.name: JSON output formatting
tools.description: Formats output in JSON.

tools.name: Cross-platform compatibility
tools.description: Ensures cross-platform compatibility.

tools.name: Execute Azure Developer CLI commands directly
tools.description: Executes Azure Developer CLI commands directly.

tools.name: Support for template discovery, template initialization, provisioning and deployment
tools.description: Supports template discovery, template initialization, provisioning, and deployment.

tools.name: Cross-platform compatibility
tools.description: Ensures cross-platform compatibility.

name: Bankless Onchain
description: Query Onchain data, like ERC20 tokens, transaction history, smart contract state.
summary: A framework for interacting with on-chain data via the Bankless API, implementing the Model Context Protocol (MCP) to allow AI models to access blockchain state and event data.

tools.name: read_contract
tools.description: Read state from smart contracts on various blockchain networks.

parameter.method: (string, required) The contract method to call
parameter.inputs: (array, required) Input parameters for the method call, each containing: { type (string), value (any) }
parameter.outputs: (array, required) Expected output types, each containing: { type (string) }

tools.name: get_proxy
tools.description: Retrieve proxy implementation contract addresses.

tools.name: get_events
tools.description: Fetch event logs for a contract based on topics.

parameter.addresses: (array, required) List of contract addresses to filter events
parameter.topic: (string, required) Primary topic to filter events
parameter.optionalTopics: (array, optional) Optional additional topics (can include null values)

tools.name: build_event_topic
tools.description: Generate an event topic signature from event name and argument types.

parameter.name: (string, required) Event name (e.g., 'Transfer(address,address,uint256)')
parameter.arguments: (array, required) Event arguments types, each containing: { type (string) }

name: Bitrise
description: Chat with your builds, CI, and more.
summary: MCP Server for the Bitrise API, enabling app management, build operations, artifact management, and more.

tools.name: list_apps
tools.description: List all the apps available for the authenticated account

parameter.sort_by: (Optional, string) Order of the apps: last_build_at (default) or created_at
parameter.next: (Optional, string) Slug of the first app in the response
parameter.limit: (Optional, integer) Max number of elements per page (default: 50)

tools.name: register_app
tools.description: Add a new app to Bitrise

parameter.is_public: (boolean) Whether the app's builds visibility is 'public'
parameter.organization_slug: (string) The organization (aka workspace) the app to add to
parameter.project_type: (Optional, string) Type of project (ios, android, etc.)

tools.name: finish_bitrise_app
tools.description: Finish the setup of a Bitrise app

parameter.app_slug: (string) The slug of the Bitrise app to finish setup for
parameter.project_type: (Optional, string) The type of project (e.g., android, ios, flutter, etc.)
parameter.stack_id: (Optional, string) The stack ID to use for the app
parameter.config: (Optional, string) The configuration to use for the app

tools.name: get_app
tools.description: Get the details of a specific app

tools.name: delete_app
tools.description: Delete an app from Bitrise

tools.name: update_app
tools.description: Update an app

parameter.is_public: (boolean) Whether the app's builds visibility is 'public'

tools.name: get_bitrise_yml
tools.description: Get the current Bitrise YML config file of a specified Bitrise app

tools.name: update_bitrise_yml
tools.description: Update the Bitrise YML config file of a specified Bitrise app

parameter.bitrise_yml_as_json: (string) The new Bitrise YML config file content

tools.name: list_branches
tools.description: List the branches with existing builds of an app's repository

tools.name: register_ssh_key
tools.description: Add an SSH-key to a specific app

parameter.is_register_key_into_provider_service: (boolean) Register the key in the provider service

tools.name: register_webhook
tools.description: Register an incoming webhook for a specific application

tools.name: list_builds
tools.description: List all the builds of a specified Bitrise app or all accessible builds

parameter.app_slug: (Optional, string) Identifier of the Bitrise app
parameter.sort_by: (Optional, string) Order of builds: created_at (default), running_first
parameter.status: (Optional, integer) Filter builds by status (0: not finished, 1: successful, 2: failed, 3: aborted, 4: in-progress)
parameter.next: (Optional, string) Slug of the first build in the response
parameter.limit: (Optional, integer) Max number of elements per page (default: 50)

tools.name: trigger_bitrise_build
tools.description: Trigger a new build/pipeline for a specified Bitrise app

parameter.branch: (Optional, string) The branch to build (default: main)
parameter.commit_message: (Optional, string) The commit message for the build
parameter.commit_hash: (Optional, string) The commit hash for the build

tools.name: get_build
tools.description: Get a specific build of a given app

tools.name: abort_build
tools.description: Abort a specific build

parameter.reason: (Optional, string) Reason for aborting the build

tools.name: get_build_log
tools.description: Get the build log of a specified build of a Bitrise app

tools.name: get_build_bitrise_yml
tools.description: Get the bitrise.yml of a build

tools.name: list_build_workflows
tools.description: List the workflows of an app

tools.name: list_artifacts
tools.description: Get a list of all build artifacts

parameter.next: (Optional, string) Slug of the first artifact in the response
parameter.limit: (Optional, integer) Max number of elements per page (default: 50)

tools.name: get_artifact
tools.description: Get a specific build artifact

tools.name: delete_artifact
tools.description: Delete a build artifact

tools.name: update_artifact
tools.description: Update a build artifact

parameter.is_public_page_enabled: (boolean) Enable public page for the artifact

tools.name: list_outgoing_webhooks
tools.description: List the outgoing webhooks of an app

tools.name: delete_outgoing_webhook
tools.description: Delete the outgoing webhook of an app

tools.name: update_outgoing_webhook
tools.description: Update an outgoing webhook for an app

parameter.events: (array) List of events to trigger the webhook
parameter.headers: (Optional, array) Headers to be sent with the webhook

tools.name: create_outgoing_webhook
tools.description: Create an outgoing webhook for an app

parameter.events: (array) List of events to trigger the webhook
parameter.headers: (Optional, array) Headers to be sent with the webhook

tools.name: list_cache_items
tools.description: List the key-value cache items belonging to an app

tools.name: delete_all_cache_items
tools.description: Delete all key-value cache items belonging to an app

tools.name: delete_cache_item
tools.description: Delete a key-value cache item

tools.name: get_cache_item_download_url
tools.description: Get the download URL of a key-value cache item

tools.name: list_pipelines
tools.description: List all pipelines and standalone builds of an app

tools.name: get_pipeline
tools.description: Get a pipeline of a given app

tools.name: abort_pipeline
tools.description: Abort a pipeline

parameter.reason: (Optional, string) Reason for aborting the pipeline

tools.name: rebuild_pipeline
tools.description: Rebuild a pipeline

tools.name: list_group_roles
tools.description: List group roles for an app

tools.name: replace_group_roles
tools.description: Replace group roles for an app

tools.name: list_workspaces
tools.description: List the workspaces the user has access to

tools.name: get_workspace
tools.description: Get details for one workspace

tools.name: get_workspace_groups
tools.description: Get the groups in a workspace

tools.name: create_workspace_group
tools.description: Create a group in a workspace

tools.name: get_workspace_members
tools.description: Get the members in a workspace

tools.name: invite_member_to_workspace
tools.description: Invite a member to a workspace

tools.name: add_member_to_group
tools.description: Add a member to a group

tools.name: me
tools.description: Get info from the currently authenticated user account

tools.name: create_connected_app
tools.description: Add a new Release Management connected app to Bitrise

parameter.platform: (string) The mobile platform for the connected app (ios/android)
parameter.store_app_id: (string) The app store identifier for the connected app
parameter.id: (Optional, string) An uuidV4 identifier for your new connected app
parameter.project_id: (Optional, string) Specifies which Bitrise Project to associate with
parameter.store_app_name: (Optional, string) App name for manual connections
parameter.store_credential_id: (Optional, string) Selection of credentials added on Bitrise

tools.name: list_connected_apps
tools.description: List Release Management connected apps available for the authenticated account within a workspace

parameter.items_per_page: (Optional, integer) Maximum number of connected apps per page
parameter.platform: (Optional, string) Filter for a specific mobile platform
parameter.project_id: (Optional, string) Filter for a specific Bitrise Project
parameter.search: (Optional, string) Search by bundle ID, package name, or app title

tools.name: get_connected_app
tools.description: Gives back a Release Management connected app for the authenticated account

parameter.id: (string) Identifier of the Release Management connected app

tools.name: update_connected_app
tools.description: Updates a connected app

parameter.connected_app_id: (string) The uuidV4 identifier for your connected app
parameter.store_app_id: (string) The store identifier for your app
parameter.connect_to_store: (Optional, boolean) Check validity against the App Store or Google Play
parameter.store_credential_id: (Optional, string) Selection of credentials added on Bitrise

tools.name: list_installable_artifacts
tools.description: List Release Management installable artifacts of a connected app

parameter.connected_app_id: (string) Identifier of the Release Management connected app
parameter.after_date: (Optional, string) Start of the interval for artifact creation/upload
parameter.artifact_type: (Optional, string) Filter for a specific artifact type
parameter.before_date: (Optional, string) End of the interval for artifact creation/upload
parameter.branch: (Optional, string) Filter for the Bitrise CI branch
parameter.distribution_ready: (Optional, boolean) Filter for distribution ready artifacts
parameter.items_per_page: (Optional, integer) Maximum number of artifacts per page
parameter.platform: (Optional, string) Filter for a specific mobile platform
parameter.search: (Optional, string) Search by version, filename or build number
parameter.source: (Optional, string) Filter for the source of installable artifacts
parameter.store_signed: (Optional, boolean) Filter for store ready installable artifacts
parameter.version: (Optional, string) Filter for a specific version
parameter.workflow: (Optional, string) Filter for a specific Bitrise CI workflow

tools.name: generate_installable_artifact_upload_url
tools.description: Generates a signed upload URL for an installable artifact to be uploaded to Bitrise

parameter.connected_app_id: (string) Identifier of the Release Management connected app
parameter.installable_artifact_id: (string) An uuidv4 identifier for the installable artifact
parameter.file_name: (string) The name of the installable artifact file
parameter.file_size_bytes: (integer) The byte size of the installable artifact file
parameter.branch: (Optional, string) Name of the CI branch
parameter.workflow: (Optional, string) Name of the CI workflow

tools.name: get_installable_artifact_upload_and_processing_status
tools.description: Gets the processing and upload status of an installable artifact

parameter.connected_app_id: (string) Identifier of the Release Management connected app
parameter.installable_artifact_id: (string) The uuidv4 identifier for the installable artifact

tools.name: set_installable_artifact_public_install_page
tools.description: Changes whether public install page should be available for the installable artifact

parameter.connected_app_id: (string) Identifier of the Release Management connected app
parameter.installable_artifact_id: (string) The uuidv4 identifier for the installable artifact
parameter.with_public_page: (boolean) Boolean flag for enabling/disabling public install page

tools.name: list_build_distribution_versions
tools.description: Lists Build Distribution versions available for testers

parameter.connected_app_id: (string) The uuidV4 identifier of the connected app
parameter.items_per_page: (Optional, integer) Maximum number of versions per page

tools.name: list_build_distribution_version_test_builds
tools.description: Gives back a list of test builds for the given build distribution version

parameter.connected_app_id: (string) The uuidV4 identifier of the connected app
parameter.version: (string) The version of the build distribution
parameter.items_per_page: (Optional, integer) Maximum number of test builds per page

tools.name: create_tester_group
tools.description: Creates a tester group for a Release Management connected app

parameter.connected_app_id: (string) The uuidV4 identifier of the connected app
parameter.name: (string) The name for the new tester group
parameter.auto_notify: (Optional, boolean) Indicates automatic notifications for the group

tools.name: notify_tester_group
tools.description: Notifies a tester group about a new test build

parameter.connected_app_id: (string) The uuidV4 identifier of the connected app
parameter.id: (string) The uuidV4 identifier of the tester group
parameter.test_build_id: (string) The unique identifier of the test build

tools.name: add_testers_to_tester_group
tools.description: Adds testers to a tester group of a connected app

parameter.connected_app_id: (string) The uuidV4 identifier of the connected app
parameter.id: (string) The uuidV4 identifier of the tester group
parameter.user_slugs: (array) The list of users identified by slugs to be added

tools.name: update_tester_group
tools.description: Updates the given tester group settings

parameter.connected_app_id: (string) The uuidV4 identifier of the connected app
parameter.id: (string) The uuidV4 identifier of the tester group
parameter.auto_notify: (Optional, boolean) Setting for automatic email notifications
parameter.name: (Optional, string) The new name for the tester group

tools.name: list_tester_groups
tools.description: Gives back a list of tester groups related to a specific connected app

parameter.connected_app_id: (string) The uuidV4 identifier of the connected app
parameter.items_per_page: (Optional, integer) Maximum number of tester groups per page

tools.name: get_tester_group
tools.description: Gives back the details of the selected tester group

parameter.connected_app_id: (string) The uuidV4 identifier of the connected app
parameter.id: (string) The uuidV4 identifier of the tester group

tools.name: get_potential_testers
tools.description: Gets a list of potential testers who can be added to a specific tester group

parameter.connected_app_id: (string) The uuidV4 identifier of the connected app
parameter.id: (string) The uuidV4 identifier of the tester group
parameter.items_per_page: (Optional, integer) Maximum number of potential testers per page
parameter.search: (Optional, string) Search for testers by email or username

name: Box
description: Interact with the Intelligent Content Management platform through Box AI.
summary: A Python project that integrates with the Box API to perform various operations such as file search, text extraction, AI-based querying, and data extraction. It leverages the `box-sdk-gen` library and provides a set of tools to interact with Box files and folders.

tools.name: box_who_am_i
tools.description: Get your current user information and check connection status.

tools.name: box_authorize_app_tool
tools.description: Start the Box application authorization process.

tools.name: box_search_tool
tools.description: Search for files in Box.

parameter.file_extensions: (List[str], optional) File extensions to filter results.
parameter.where_to_look_for_query: (List[str], optional) Locations to search (e.g. NAME, DESCRIPTION, FILE_CONTENT, COMMENTS, TAG).
parameter.ancestor_folder_ids: (List[str], optional) List of folder IDs in which to search.

tools.name: box_read_tool
tools.description: Read the text content of a Box file.

parameter.file_id: (str) ID of the file to read

tools.name: box_ask_ai_tool
tools.description: Ask Box AI about a file.

tools.name: box_hubs_ask_ai_tool
tools.description: Ask Box AI about a hub. There is currently no way via API to discover a hub ID, so you must know the ID to use this tool. We will fix this in the future.

tools.name: box_search_folder_by_name
tools.description: Locate a folder by name.

tools.name: box_ai_extract_data
tools.description: Extract data from a file using AI.

tools.name: box_list_folder_content_by_folder_id
tools.description: List folder contents.

tools.name: box_manage_folder_tool
tools.description: Create, update, or delete folders in Box.

parameter.folder_id: (str, optional) ID of the folder (required for delete/update)
parameter.name: (str, optional) Folder name (required for create, optional for update)
parameter.parent_id: (str, optional) Parent folder ID (required for create, optional for update)
parameter.recursive: (bool, optional) Whether to delete recursively (optional for delete)

tools.name: box_upload_file_from_path_tool
tools.description: Upload a file to Box from a local filesystem path.

parameter.new_file_name: (str, optional) New file name (if not provided, uses the original file name)

tools.name: box_upload_file_from_content_tool
tools.description: Upload content as a file to Box.

parameter.content: (str | bytes) Content to upload (text or binary)
parameter.file_name: (str) The name to assign the file
parameter.is_base64: (bool, optional) Indicates if the provided content is base64 encoded

tools.name: box_download_file_tool
tools.description: Download a file from Box.

parameter.file_id: (str) The ID of the file to download
parameter.save_file: (bool, optional) Whether to save the file locally
parameter.save_path: (str, optional) The local path where the file should be saved

tools.name: box_docgen_create_batch_tool
tools.description: Generate documents using a Box Doc Gen template and a local JSON file.

parameter.destination_folder_id: (str) Folder ID where generated documents should be stored
parameter.user_input_file_path: (str) Path to a JSON file with input data

tools.name: box_docgen_get_job_tool
tools.description: Fetch a single Doc Gen job by its ID.

tools.name: box_docgen_list_jobs_tool
tools.description: List all Doc Gen jobs associated with the current user.

parameter.limit: (int | None, optional) Maximum number of jobs to return

tools.name: box_docgen_list_jobs_by_batch_tool
tools.description: List Doc Gen jobs belonging to a specific batch.

parameter.limit: (int | None, optional) Maximum number of jobs to return

tools.name: box_docgen_template_create_tool
tools.description: Mark a file as a Box Doc Gen template.

parameter.file_id: (str) File ID to mark as a template

tools.name: box_docgen_template_list_tool
tools.description: List all available Box Doc Gen templates.

parameter.limit: (int | None, optional) Maximum number of templates to list

tools.name: box_docgen_template_delete_tool
tools.description: Remove the Doc Gen template marking from a file.

tools.name: box_docgen_template_get_by_id_tool
tools.description: Retrieve details of a specific Doc Gen template.

tools.name: box_docgen_template_list_tags_tool
tools.description: List all tags associated with a Box Doc Gen template.

parameter.limit: (int | None, optional) Maximum number of tags to return

tools.name: box_docgen_template_list_jobs_tool
tools.description: List all Doc Gen jobs that used a specific template.

parameter.limit: (int | None, optional) Maximum number of jobs to list

name: Chroma
description: Embeddings, vector search, document storage, and full-text search with the open-source AI application database
summary: An MCP server that provides data retrieval capabilities powered by Chroma, enabling AI models to create and manage collections of data and perform various operations like vector search, full text search, and metadata filtering.

tools.name: chroma_list_collections
tools.description: List all collections with pagination support

tools.name: chroma_create_collection
tools.description: Create a new collection with optional HNSW configuration

tools.name: chroma_peek_collection
tools.description: View a sample of documents in a collection

tools.name: chroma_get_collection_info
tools.description: Get detailed information about a collection

tools.name: chroma_get_collection_count
tools.description: Get the number of documents in a collection

tools.name: chroma_modify_collection
tools.description: Update a collection's name or metadata

tools.name: chroma_delete_collection
tools.description: Delete a collection

tools.name: chroma_add_documents
tools.description: Add documents with optional metadata and custom IDs

tools.name: chroma_query_documents
tools.description: Query documents using semantic search with advanced filtering

tools.name: chroma_get_documents
tools.description: Retrieve documents by IDs or filters with pagination

tools.name: chroma_update_documents
tools.description: Update existing documents' content, metadata, or embeddings

tools.name: chroma_delete_documents
tools.description: Delete specific documents from a collection

name: CircleCI
description: Enable AI Agents to fix build failures from CircleCI.
summary: An MCP Server for CircleCI that allows users to interact with CircleCI using natural language through various MCP clients such as Cursor IDE, VS Code, Claude Desktop, Claude Code, and Windsurf. It provides tools for retrieving build failure logs, finding flaky tests, getting the latest pipeline status, retrieving job test results, validating CircleCI configurations, creating prompt templates, and generating test cases for prompt templates.

tools.name: get_build_failure_logs
tools.description: Retrieves detailed failure logs from CircleCI builds. Can be used with CircleCI URLs or local project context.

parameter.url_or_context: (string) Either a CircleCI URL or a combination of workspace root path, Git remote URL, and branch name

tools.name: find_flaky_tests
tools.description: Identifies flaky tests in a CircleCI project by analyzing test execution history. Can be used with CircleCI project URLs or local project context.

parameter.url_or_context: (string) Either a CircleCI project URL or a combination of workspace root path and Git remote URL

tools.name: get_latest_pipeline_status
tools.description: Retrieves the status of the latest pipeline for a given branch. Can be used with CircleCI project URLs or local project context.

parameter.url_or_context: (string) Either a CircleCI project URL or a combination of workspace root path, Git remote URL, and branch name

tools.name: get_job_test_results
tools.description: Retrieves test metadata for CircleCI jobs. Can be used with CircleCI URLs or local project context.

parameter.url_or_context: (string) Either a CircleCI URL (job, workflow, or pipeline) or a combination of workspace root path, Git remote URL, and branch name

tools.name: config_helper
tools.description: Assists with CircleCI configuration tasks by providing guidance and validation. Can validate CircleCI config files.

tools.name: create_prompt_template
tools.description: Helps generate structured prompt templates for AI-enabled applications based on feature requirements.

parameter.requirements: (string) User requirements for the prompt template

tools.name: recommend_prompt_template_tests
tools.description: Generates test cases for prompt templates to ensure they produce expected results.

parameter.template: (string) The prompt template to generate tests for

name: ClickHouse
description: Query your ClickHouse database server.
summary: An MCP server designed to interact with ClickHouse clusters, providing tools to execute SQL queries, list databases, and list tables within a database.

tools.name: run_select_query
tools.description: Execute SQL queries on your ClickHouse cluster.

tools.name: list_databases
tools.description: List all databases on your ClickHouse cluster.

tools.name: list_tables
tools.description: List all tables in a database.

name: Codacy
description: Interact with Codacy API to query code quality issues, vulnerabilities, and coverage insights about your code.
summary: MCP Server for the Codacy API, enabling access to repositories, files, quality, coverage, security, and more.

tools.name: codacy_list_organizations
tools.description: List organizations with pagination support.

tools.name: codacy_list_organization_repositories
tools.description: List repositories in an organization with pagination support.

tools.name: codacy_get_repository_with_analysis
tools.description: Get repository with analysis information, including metrics for Grade, Issues, Duplication, Complexity, and Coverage.

tools.name: codacy_list_repository_issues
tools.description: Lists and filters code quality issues in a repository. This is the primary tool for investigating general code quality concerns (e.g., best practices, performance, complexity, style) but NOT security issues. For security-related issues, use the SRM items tool instead.

parameter.author: (Optional, string) Filter by author
parameter.branch: (Optional, string) Specify the branch for analysis

tools.name: codacy_list_files
tools.description: List files in a repository with pagination support.

tools.name: codacy_get_file_issues
tools.description: Get the issue list for a file in a repository.

tools.name: codacy_get_file_coverage
tools.description: Get coverage information for a file in the head commit of a repository branch.

tools.name: codacy_get_file_clones
tools.description: Get the list of duplication clones (identical or very similar code segments) for a file in a repository.

tools.name: codacy_get_file_with_analysis
tools.description: Get detailed analysis information for a file, including metrics for Grade, Issues, Duplication, Complexity, and Coverage.

tools.name: codacy_search_organization_srm_items
tools.description: Primary tool to list security items/issues/vulnerabilities/findings across an organization. Results are related to the organization's security and risk management (SRM) dashboard on Codacy.

tools.name: codacy_search_repository_srm_items
tools.description: List security items/issues/vulnerabilities/findings for a specific repository.

tools.name: codacy_list_repository_pull_requests
tools.description: List pull requests from a repository that the user has access to.

tools.name: codacy_get_repository_pull_request
tools.description: Get detailed information about a specific pull request.

tools.name: codacy_list_pull_request_issues
tools.description: Returns a list of issues found in a pull request (new or fixed issues).

tools.name: codacy_get_pull_request_files_coverage
tools.description: Get diff coverage information for all files in a pull request.

tools.name: codacy_get_pull_request_git_diff
tools.description: Returns the human-readable Git diff of a pull request.

tools.name: codacy_list_tools
tools.description: List all code analysis tools available in Codacy.

tools.name: codacy_list_repository_tools
tools.description: Get analysis tools settings and available tools for a repository.

tools.name: codacy_get_pattern
tools.description: Get the definition of a specific pattern.

tools.name: codacy_list_repository_tool_patterns
tools.description: List the patterns of a tool available for a repository.

tools.name: codacy_get_issue
tools.description: Get detailed information about a specific issue.

tools.name: codacy_cli_analyze
tools.description: Run quality analysis locally using Codacy CLI. Features include analyzing specific files or entire directories, using specific tools or all available tools, getting immediate results without waiting for scheduled analysis, and applying fixes based on Codacy configuration.

name: CodeLogic
description: Interact with CodeLogic, a Software Intelligence platform that graphs complex code and data architecture dependencies, to boost AI accuracy and insight.
summary: An MCP Server that leverages Codelogic's rich software dependency data to provide impact assessments for code and database modifications in AI programming assistants.

tools.name: codelogic-method-impact
tools.description: Pulls an impact assessment from the CodeLogic server's APIs for the specified code method and class.

parameter.method: (string) The method that you're working on
parameter.class: (string) The class associated with the method

tools.name: codelogic-database-impact
tools.description: Analyzes impacts between code and database entities.

parameter.entity_type: (string) The type of database entity (column, table, or view)
parameter.entity_name: (string) The name of the database entity

name: Comet Opik
description: Query and analyze your Opik logs, traces, prompts and all other telemtry data from your LLMs in natural language.
summary: An open-source implementation of the Model Context Protocol for the Opik platform, providing a unified interface for interacting with Opik's capabilities and supporting multiple transport mechanisms for flexible integration into various environments.

tools.name: Prompts Management
tools.description: Create, list, update, and delete prompts

tools.name: Projects/Workspaces Management
tools.description: Organize and manage projects

tools.name: Traces
tools.description: Track and analyze trace data

tools.name: Metrics
tools.description: Gather and query metrics data

name: Couchbase
description: Interact with the data stored in Couchbase clusters.
summary: An MCP server implementation of Couchbase that enables LLMs to interact directly with Couchbase clusters, allowing for CRUD operations and SQL++ queries.

tools.name: get_scopes_and_collections
tools.description: Get a list of all the scopes and collections in the specified bucket.

tools.name: get_collection_structure
tools.description: Get the structure for a collection.

tools.name: get_document_by_id
tools.description: Get a document by ID from a specified scope and collection.

tools.name: upsert_document_by_id
tools.description: Upsert a document by ID to a specified scope and collection.

tools.name: delete_document_by_id
tools.description: Delete a document by ID from a specified scope and collection.

tools.name: run_sqlpp_query
tools.description: Run a SQL++ query on a specified scope. The `READ_ONLY_QUERY_MODE` environment variable controls whether data-modifying queries are allowed.

name: Dart
description: Interact with task, doc, and project data in Dart, an AI-native project management tool
summary: The official AI Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Dart, providing AI-powered project management capabilities such as task and document management.

tools.name: get_config
tools.description: Get information about the user's space, including available assignees, dartboards, folders, statuses, tags, priorities, and sizes

tools.name: list_tasks
tools.description: List tasks with optional filtering by assignee, status, dartboard, priority, due date, and more

tools.name: create_task
tools.description: Create a new task with title, description, status, priority, size, dates, dartboard, assignees, tags, and parent task

tools.name: get_task
tools.description: Retrieve an existing task by its ID

tools.name: update_task
tools.description: Update an existing task's properties

tools.name: delete_task
tools.description: Move a task to the trash (recoverable)

tools.name: list_docs
tools.description: List docs with optional filtering by folder, title, text content, and more

tools.name: create_doc
tools.description: Create a new doc with title, text content, and folder

tools.name: get_doc
tools.description: Retrieve an existing doc by its ID

tools.name: update_doc
tools.description: Update an existing doc's properties

tools.name: delete_doc
tools.description: Move a doc to the trash (recoverable)

name: DevHub
description: Manage and utilize website content within the DevHub CMS platform
summary: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) integration for managing content in the DevHub CMS system. It allows Large Language Models to manage businesses, locations, blog posts, and media without direct API access.

tools.name: get_businesses
tools.description: Gets all businesses within the DevHub account. Returns a list of businesses with their IDs and names.

tools.name: get_locations
tools.description: Gets all locations for a specific business. Returns detailed location information including address, coordinates, and URLs.

tools.name: get_hours_of_operation
tools.description: Gets the hours of operation for a specific DevHub location. Returns a structured list of time ranges for each day of the week.

parameter.hours_type: (Optional, string) The type of hours to retrieve, default is 'primary'.

tools.name: update_hours
tools.description: Updates the hours of operation for a DevHub location.

parameter.hours_type: (Optional, string) The type of hours to update, default is 'primary'.

tools.name: get_nearest_location
tools.description: Finds the nearest DevHub location based on geographic coordinates.

tools.name: site_from_url
tools.description: Gets the DevHub site ID and details from a URL. Returns site ID, URL, and associated location IDs.

parameter.url: (string) The URL of the DevHub site.

tools.name: get_blog_post
tools.description: Retrieves a single blog post by ID, including its title, date, and HTML content.

parameter.post_id: (string) The ID of the blog post.

tools.name: create_blog_post
tools.description: Creates a new blog post. The content should be in HTML format and should not include an H1 tag.

parameter.site_id: (string) The ID of the site where the blog post will be created.
parameter.title: (string) The title of the blog post.
parameter.content: (string) The HTML content of the blog post.

tools.name: update_blog_post
tools.description: Updates an existing blog post's title and/or content.

parameter.post_id: (string) The ID of the blog post.
parameter.title: (Optional, string) The new title of the blog post.
parameter.content: (Optional, string) The new HTML content of the blog post.

tools.name: upload_image
tools.description: Uploads an image to the DevHub media gallery. Supports webp, jpeg, and png formats. The image must be provided as a base64-encoded string.

parameter.base64_image_content: (string) The base64-encoded content of the image.

name: Dynatrace
description: Manage and interact with the Dynatrace Platform  for real-time observability and monitoring.
summary: A remote MCP server that enables interaction with the Dynatrace observability platform, allowing real-time observability data to be integrated into development workflows. It supports fetching production-level data, monitoring exceptions, logs, and anomalies, and provides more context on security issues.

tools.name: list_problems
tools.description: Lists problem details from your services, such as Kubernetes.

tools.name: get_security_problems
tools.description: Lists and retrieves security problems or vulnerability details.

tools.name: execute_dql
tools.description: Executes DQL (Dynatrace Query Language) queries to fetch events or logs.

tools.name: send_slack_message
tools.description: Sends Slack messages using the Slack Connector.

tools.name: set_up_notification_workflow
tools.description: Sets up notification workflows using the Dynatrace Automation Engine.

tools.name: get_ownership
tools.description: Retrieves ownership information of an entity.
